results.title: Space colony
results.brief_description: Interactive game where you create your own city with each residential structure being sufficiently resourced with food, water and energy to maintain the population. The player wins the game when they have reached the target population of 10,000. Based on real time strategy and city simulation games.

results.title: Space ballet: a story of Apollo 9
results.creator_credit: United States Information Agency and United States. National Aeronautics Space Administration
results.brief_description: The flight of Apollo 9 to splashdown on March 13, 1969, showing the flight of the Lunar Module, the first in space history. Emphasis is placed on the human aspects of the flight. Music is from the feature film, “Yellow Submarine”. Narrated by Pernell Roberts.

results.title: Space
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “The Dance”.
Space is the dancer’s canvas. In this film, animation is used in addition to live action to give a picture of space both inside and outside the dancer’s body.

results.title: SPAA Conference 2002
results.brief_description: The Screen Producers Conference is the key national industry conference and is to be held in Melbourne 2001, 2002 and 2003. The conference delegates represent the major broadcast networks, production houses and independent producers in Australia. The Conference is a three day event and usually coincides with the annual Australian Film Institute (AFI)Awards.

results.title: Sown pastures
results.brief_description: A record of an experiment carried out at the CSIRO Research Station, Armidale, N.S.W., which shows the improvement in health and wool returns of sheep grazing sown pastures compared with those grazing natural pasture. Coloured graphs are used to show more clearly the differences between these two groups of sheep.

results.title: Sovereign Hill: goldmining township, Ballarat
results.brief_description: A look at Sovereign Hill- a reconstructed goldmining town in Ballarat. Shows not only the buildings and the implements but also shows how the people lived.

results.title: Sovereign hill
results.creator_credit: Penny Spence, Nine Network and Peter Dodds
results.brief_description: Filmed on location at Sovereign Hill, Ballarat, this Australian documentary recreates the nineteenth century to explain the historical events surrounding gold discovery in Australia. Produced with the assistance of the Management and Friends of Sovereign Hill Gold Mining Township. A study guide accompanies the video.
